result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant in court, in custody.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn filed mtn to modify bond. State does not object to change of bond condition to:  - Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards M.R.S. Preliminary hearing on June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Mya S. 
- Defendant shall not be within 1,000 feet of Mya S. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 4700 block of Hayes Rd. 
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 5

01:52 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jacob A Idlas.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
